SEARCH
Package fr.lirmm.chocominer.api.controllers

Class DataMiningController

java.lang.Object
fr.lirmm.chocominer.api.controllers.DataMiningController
@RestController @Validated public class DataMiningController extends Object
Controller dedicated to handle all execution and requests related to data mining operations.

  • Constructor Details

    • DataMiningController

      @Autowired public DataMiningController(IMSpecializedManager imSpecializedManager, IMDeclarativeManager imDeclarativeManager, IMDeclarativeToSpecializedManager iMDeclarativeToSpecializedManager, IMSpecializedToDeclarativeManager imSpecializedToDeclarativeManager, ARMSpecializedManager armSpecializedManager, ARMDeclarativeManager armDeclarativeManager)
      Constructor to initialize the DataMiningController with necessary services and dependencies.
      Parameters:
      imSpecializedManager - Service to handle specialized itemset mining operations
      imDeclarativeManager - Service to handle declarative itemset mining operations
      iMDeclarativeToSpecializedManager - Service to handle conversion from declarative itemset mining to specialized mining
      imSpecializedToDeclarativeManager - Service to handle conversion from specialized itemset mining to declarative mining
      armSpecializedManager - Service to handle specialized association rule mining operations.
      armDeclarativeManager - Service to handle declarative association rule mining operations.

  • Method Details

    • executeItemSetMining

      @CrossOrigin @PostMapping("itemset-mining/execute") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> executeItemSetMining(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid ConstraintsRequest constraintsRequest) throws IOException, InvocationTargetException, IllegalAccessException, InstantiationException
      Handles the execution of itemset mining operations based on the provided ConstraintsRequest. Uses the different managers to check the type of data mining desired by the client. (declarative or specialized).
      If the ConstraintsRequest.library attribute is defined, this method will try and force the usage of the given library. If said attribute is not defined it will determine the type of data mining and run the appropriate library.
      Parameters:
      constraintsRequest - Request containing constraints and details for data mining
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with the result of the data mining operation or an error message
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during file handling
      InvocationTargetException - If an exception occurs during method invocation
      IllegalAccessException - If an application attempts to reflectively create an instance (other than an array), set or get a field, or invoke a method, but the currently executing method does not have access to the definition of the specified class, field, method or constructor
      InstantiationException - If an application tries to create an instance of an abstract class or interface, or if the instantiation fails for some other reason

    • executeAssociationRuleMining

      @CrossOrigin @PostMapping("association-rule-mining/execute") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> executeAssociationRuleMining(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid ConstraintsRequest constraintsRequest) throws IOException, InvocationTargetException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException
      Handles the execution of association rule mining operations based on the provided ConstraintsRequest. Uses the different managers to check the type of data mining desired by the client. (declarative or specialized).
      Parameters:
      constraintsRequest - Request containing constraints and details for data mining
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with the result of the data mining operation or an error message
      Throws:

    • itemSetMiningPreview

      @CrossOrigin @PostMapping("itemset-mining/preview") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> itemSetMiningPreview(@RequestBody ConstraintsRequest constraintsRequest, @RequestParam float timeout, int maxSol) throws IOException, InvocationTargetException, IllegalAccessException, InstantiationException
      Handles the execution of itemset mining previewing. This allows to recuperate a defined number of solutions or to stop solving solutions after a certain defined runtime limit. Uses the different IMDeclarativeManager to check if the request is declarative and itemset mining. Only work when using declarative constraints.
      Parameters:
      constraintsRequest - Request containing constraints and details for data mining
      timeout - The maximum runtime of this route.
      maxSol - The maximum number of solutions this route can return.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with the result of the data mining operation or an error message
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during file handling
      InvocationTargetException - If an exception occurs during method invocation
      IllegalAccessException - If an application attempts to reflectively create an instance (other than an array), set or get a field, or invoke a method, but the currently executing method does not have access to the definition of the specified class, field, method or constructor
      InstantiationException - If an application tries to create an instance of an abstract class or interface, or if the instantiation fails for some other reason

    • associationRuleMiningPreview

      @CrossOrigin @PostMapping("association-rule-mining/preview") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> associationRuleMiningPreview(@RequestBody ConstraintsRequest constraintsRequest, @RequestParam float timeout, @RequestParam int maxSol) throws IOException, InvocationTargetException, IllegalAccessException, InstantiationException
      Handles the execution of association rule mining previewing. This allows to recuperate a defined number of solutions or to stop solving solutions after a certain defined runtime limit. Uses the different ARMDeclarativeManager to check if the request is declarative and association rule mining. Only work when using declarative constraints.
      Parameters:
      constraintsRequest - Request containing constraints and details for data mining
      timeout - The maximum runtime of this route.
      maxSol - The maximum number of solutions this route can return.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with the result of the data mining operation or an error message
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during file handling
      InvocationTargetException - If an exception occurs during method invocation
      IllegalAccessException - If an application attempts to reflectively create an instance (other than an array), set or get a field, or invoke a method, but the currently executing method does not have access to the definition of the specified class, field, method or constructor
      InstantiationException - If an application tries to create an instance of an abstract class or interface, or if the instantiation fails for some other reason
